text:
The installation aborts due to an older version of mod_jrun20.c.  Where can I 
find the required version (ca. Sept 2002?).Thanks.
creator: philip.morley@sap.com
nd@perlig.de
text:
This is certainly not the right place to ask. Please contact the vendor of
mod_jrun20.

Thanks for using Apache.

Thanks for your reply.
The error occurs during the install of the latest version of Apache for 
Windows.  Since I did not separately order or install mod_jrun20, I would 
assume that this is part of the installation package (i.e. the expected version 
would be part of the install).  As a work around, the previous version of 
Apache for Windows works.
creator: philip.morley@sap.com
ianh@apache.org
text:
by default, apache does not overwrite your configuration file.

I am assuming that at one time you have installed mod_jrun and it/you edited
your configuration file to include it.

by the looks of it jrun is only supported on 2.0.42
http://www.macromedia.com/support/jrun/ts/documents/tn18239.htm

closing the bug.

creator: philip.morley@sap.com
text:
Thanks again for the information.  This laptop comes with various pre-
configured installations (which I have now discovered included Macromedia's 
JRun).  1.0.13 works fine; will try 2.0.42.
